column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Roma Agents yarded 6,745 head. All the regular processors feedlotters and backgrounders and present but selective. The market could not maintain the levels of last sale. A quality yarding of heavy heifers and cows penned.

Yearling steers under 200g made to 330c/kg. Yearling steers 200 to 280kg topped 488c/kg. Yearling steers 280 to 330kg with the majority selling from 302c to 452c/kg. Yearling steers 330 to 400kg made from 354c to 428c/kg for the better pens. Yearling steers 400 to 480kg sold from 314c to 382c to feed and 386c/kg to restockers. Yearling steers over 480kg made from 324c to 408c/kg to feed.

Yearling heifers under 200kg topped 326c/kg. Yearling heifers 200 to 280kg made from 210c for the plainer types to 364c/kg. Yearling heifers 280 to 330kg sold from 210 to 354c/kg. Yearling heifers 330 to 400kg made to 364c/kg to restockers. Yearling heifers 400 to 480kg made to 362c/kg. Yearling heifers over 480kg topped 336c/kg to processors.

Bullocks over 600kg topped 340c with grown heifers over 540kg 337c/kg to processors. A quality yarding of cows penned and improved marginally. The 2 score cows 400 to 520kg sold from 200c to 276c/kg. The 3 score cows over 520kg topped 318c and sold from 270c/kg. Bulls over 600kg topped 308c/kg. Bulls 450 to 600kg to 320c and young bulls under 450kg made 412c/kg to restockers.

Market Reporter David Friend.
